text: this is a luxury car it looks the part
with handsome sheetmetal the interior is

and you knew this was coming

of them work well here in the US
forte is the k3 Optima k5 cadenza k7

there's a bit of growl
the 8-speed transmission gets a BMW like
controller sorry to say power goes to
the back wheels k900 can hustle its
prints serenely from standstill to 60 in
five and a half seconds there is a sport
mode that remaps the throttle and

war for comfort if you want sport you

out of with all the money you've saved
there's not much feedback from the

Continental not BMW 7-series
a stout structure hushed interior and
radar assistant cruise control improve
road trips kia does a commendable job
inside k900 looks expensive and modern
materials feel rich the expected premium
touches are here heat and ventilation
for the supple leather seats navigation
a great view of the sky and precise
delivery from the lexicon audio system
unfortunately like many luxury cars the
interface requires some practice k900
does have some great tech but if you
want the real cutting-edge stuff like
auto breaking for pedestrians or
cyclists you have to go with the premium
brands the only option available is a
$6,000 VIP package it includes this
helpful bird's-eye view camera system a
better seat for the driver head-up
display and power-assisted doors that is
a lot of kit but kia doesn't have the
rich depth and dealer experience found
without a Lexus and Mercedes luxury
sedans often have a raised seating
position and a bulge here not exactly
sure why they do that the outboard
positions of the k900 are much much more
comfortable there are more features back
here than most cars have in total many
of the goodies such as reclining heated
and vented seating are part of the VIP
package those in back can control the
front passenger's position just wait
until the kids find out about that
buying in bulk is another good way to
save money this might be a bit excessive
the seatbacks do not split or fold
there is no spare this large car has the
trunk of a midsize sedan k900 maxes out
at six bundles LeBron James is signed on
